author: pderop
msg: Finalized support for parallel mode: the threadpool, as suggested by Xander, should not be provided by user activators.
As a proposed solution, the threadpool is now tracked from the OSGi service registry.
And when a component is added to a DependencyManager, then a threadpool is used if there is one available from the registry.
So, a management agent bundle can simply register a java.util.Executor threadpool and must be started first (using a start level service).
If start level service can't be used, then a "org.apache.felix.dependencymanager.parallel=true" system property can be configured
and in this case, DependencyManager will wait for a threadpool before activating any DM components (all components
will be cached until an available threadpool is registered in the service registry).

author: rfscholte
msg: IDE fix, when localRepository is not a System property

author: markt
msg: Fix threading issue. Multiple threads could, sequentially, create a new
sslContext when there should only be one. Identified by Coverity scan.
